title: The Moon Pool

title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: the irised curtain had hidden, still it was as though some thing of
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: supernal beauty and wonder had been swept away, never to be replaced;
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: a glamour gone for ever; a work of the high gods destroyed.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: "Let's go back," said Larry abruptly.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: I dropped a little behind them to examine a bit of carving--and,
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: after all, they did not want me. I watched them pacing slowly ahead,
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: his arm around her, black hair close to bronze-gold ringlets. Then I
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: followed. Half were they over the bridge when through the roar of the
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: imprisoned stream I heard my name called softly.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: "Goodwin!  Dr. Goodwin!"
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: Amazed, I turned.  From behind the pedestal of a carved group
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: slunk--Marakinoff! My premonition had been right. Some way he had
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: escaped, slipped through to here. He held his hands high, came forward
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: cautiously.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: "I am finished," he whispered--"Done!  I don't care what _they'll_ do
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: to me." He nodded toward the handmaiden and Larry, now at the end of
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: the bridge and passing on, oblivious of all save each other. He drew
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: closer. His eyes were sunken, burning, mad; his face etched with deep
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: lines, as though a graver's tool had cut down through it. I took a
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: step backward.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: A grin, like the grimace of a fiend, blasted the Russian's visage.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: He threw himself upon me, his hands clenching at my throat!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: "Larry!" I yelled--and as I spun around under the shock of his
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: onslaught, saw the two turn, stand paralyzed, then race toward me.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: "But _you'll_ carry nothing out of here!" shrieked Marakinoff.  "No!"
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: My foot, darting out behind me, touched vacancy.  The roaring of the
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: racing stream deafened me. I felt its mists about me; threw myself
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: forward.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: I was falling--falling--with the Russian's hand strangling me. I
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: struck water, sank; the hands that gripped my throat relaxed for a
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: moment their clutch. I strove to writhe loose; felt that I was being
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: hurled with dreadful speed on--full realization came--on the breast of
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: that racing torrent dropping from some far ocean cleft and
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: rushing--where? A little time, a few breathless instants, I struggled
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: with the devil who clutched me--inflexibly, indomitably.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: Then a shrieking as of all the pent winds of the universe in my
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: ears--blackness!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: Consciousness returned slowly, agonizedly.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: "Larry!" I groaned.  "Lakla!"
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: A brilliant light was glowing through my closed lids.  It hurt.  I
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: opened my eyes, closed them with swords and needles of dazzling pain
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: shooting through them. Again I opened them cautiously. It was the sun!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: I staggered to my feet.  Behind me was a shattered wall of basalt
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: monoliths, hewn and squared. Before me was the Pacific, smooth and
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: blue and smiling.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: And not far away, cast up on the strand even as I had been,
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: was--Marakinoff!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: He lay there, broken and dead indeed.  Yet all the waters through
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: which we had passed--not even the waters of death themselves--could
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: wash from his face the grin of triumph. With the last of my strength I
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: dragged the body from the strand and pushed it out into the waves. A
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: little billow ran up, coiled about it, and carried it away, ducking
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: and bending. Another seized it, and another, playing with it. It
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: floated from my sight--that which had been Marakinoff, with all his
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: schemes to turn our fair world into an undreamed-of-hell.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: My strength began to come back to me.  I found a thicket and slept;
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: slept it must have been for many hours, for when I again awakened the
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: dawn was rosing the east. I will not tell my sufferings. Suffice it to
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: say that I found a spring and some fruit, and just before dusk had
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: recovered enough to writhe up to the top of the wall and discover
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: where I was.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: The place was one of the farther islets of the Nan-Matal. To the north
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: I caught the shadows of the ruins of Nan-Tauach, where was the moon
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: door, black against the sky. Where was the moon door--which, someway,
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: somehow, I must reach, and quickly.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: At dawn of the next day I got together driftwood and bound it together
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: in shape of a rough raft with fallen creepers. Then, with a makeshift
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: paddle, I set forth for Nan-Tauach. Slowly, painfully, I crept up to
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: it. It was late afternoon before I grounded my shaky craft on the
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: little beach between the ruined sea-gates and, creeping up the giant
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: steps, made my way to the inner enclosure.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: And at its opening I stopped, and the tears ran streaming down my
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: cheeks while I wept aloud with sorrow and with disappointment and with
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: weariness.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: For the great wall in which had been set the pale slab whose threshold
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: we had crossed to the land of the Shining One lay shattered and
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: broken. The monoliths were heaped about; the wall had fallen, and
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: about them shone a film of water, half covering them.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: There was no moon door!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: Dazed and weeping, I drew closer, climbed upon their outlying
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: fragments. I looked out only upon the sea. There had been a great
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: subsidence, an earth shock, perhaps, tilting downward all that
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: side--the echo, little doubt, of that cataclysm which had blasted the
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: Dweller's lair!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: The little squared islet called Tau, in which were hidden the seven
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: globes, had entirely disappeared. Upon the waters there was no trace
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: of it.
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: The moon door was gone; the passage to the Moon Pool was closed to
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: me--its chamber covered by the sea!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: There was no road to Larry--nor to Lakla!
title: The Moon Pool
author: Merritt, Abraham

text: And there, for me, the world ended.
